gov.loc.repository.bagit.transfer

Interface FileFetcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cancellable, ProgressListenable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExternalRsyncFetchProtocol.ExternalRsyncFetcher, FtpFetchProtocol.FtpFetcher, HttpFetchProtocol.HttpFetcher, LocalFileFetchProtocol.LocalFileFetcher

    public interface FileFetcher
extends Cancellable, ProgressListenable
    Fetches files from a remote destination.

    Threading

    A multi-threading retriever may run several FileFetchers of the same type against the same server simultaneously. However, a given FileFetcher may be asked to retrieve multiple files sequentially, and so may leave persistent connections to remote servers open for performance. However, it is guaranteed that a given FileFetcher instance will not have its fetchFile() method called in any thread before the current invocation completes.

    Retry

    It is up to the implementation of this interface to handle fetch retries as appropriate for their protocol. A failed fetch attempt should only throw a BagTransferException after all retry and error correction has been exhausted.

    If a particular invocation of fetchFilefetchFile() fails and throws a BagTransferException, the FileFetcher should be prepared to accept additional calls to fetchFile(). Only after the close() method is called will there be no more files to fetch.

    See Also:
    #fetchFile(URI, Long, FetchedFileDestination), BagTransferException

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize()
                throws BagTransferException
        Permits the FileFetcher to initialize. Guaranteed to be called prior to any calls to fetchFile().
        Throws:
        BagTransferException - Thrown if an error occurs during initialization.

      • close

        void close()
        Permits the FileFetcher to clean up. Guaranteed to not be called until all calls to fetchFile() are completed, and no more class to fetchFile() will occur after the call to close().

      • fetchFile

        void fetchFile(java.net.URI uri,
             java.lang.Long size,
             FetchedFileDestination destination,
             FetchContext context)
               throws BagTransferException
        Fetches a single file. Each call to this method corresponds to the desire to fetch a single line from a fetch.txt.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to be fetched. If the URI scheme cannotbe handled by this fetcher, then a BagTransferException should be thrown.
        size - The size of the file. If no size was specified, this will be null.
        destination - The destination for the fetched file.
        context - The context for this fetch.
        Throws:
        BagTransferException - Thrown if the file could not be fetched for any reason.
